snippet: Initial claims for unemployment benefits fell last week, while wholesale inventories rose in August by the largest amount in four months, both signs of an economy gaining traction.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that weekly claims for unemployment benefits dropped 1,000, to seasonally adjusted 287,000, nearly their lowest level since before the 2007-9 recession; growing strength in the labor market adds to evidence of accelerating economy.
lead_paragraph: Initial claims for unemployment benefits fell last week, while wholesale inventories rose in August by the largest amount in four months, both signs of an economy gaining traction.

headline.main: Unemployment Data Points to Accelerating Economy
headline.print_headline: Unemployment Data Points to Accelerating Economy
